choices: Look at those shipwrecks. There might be something useful.
Head into the jungle, towards the center of the island.
Head to the cliffs. There might be a mountain spring or something.
Head to the field. You might get a clearer view of the island from there.
See if someone made the fire that smoke is coming from.
1.content:
"Oh, my head..." You say slowly as you come to consciousness. You feel wet sand under you, and the smell of salty air fills your nostrils as you breathe. You pick your head up and open your eyes slowly.

"An island?" you ask nobody in particular. "Oh great... I guess I should at least see what`s around me."

You took a look around, and besides noticing your clothes were sopping wet and torn a bit, you saw that there were a few trees on the beach as well as the remnants of easily more than one ship just off the coast near some rocks which led up to a tall cliff. There was also a jungle nearby that seemed to part open and form a path, like someone had been walking there for a long time, and to the left of that was a large field that seemed to go on for a long time and wrap around the other side of the island. And you could also see a column of smoke coming from more towards the center of the island. Someone had to have started a fire to get smoke like that. The island might have some other people on it.

"Well, I can`t sit around all day, I have to find fresh water," you said to yourself, rubbing your head. "Not only that, but I need a place to sleep and food. But water comes first."

Right now, you had no choice but to explore. The question is, where to?
1.title: Waking Up

choices: You were quick enough to get away.
Too slow! Whatever it was pounced!
You wait a bit longer, hoping to catch a glimpse of whatever this thing is...
15.content:
"I better check out that smoke," you said to yourself. "Worst thing that happens is that no one`s there and I have to let it die out."

You picked yourself up and dusted some of the sand off your legs and arms before heading towards the column of smoke.

-X-

"Jeez, I never knew not having shoes could be so painful," you said, picking stones out of your feet while you sat down on a big tree root. "Still, I`ll have to get used to it if I`m gonna be stuck here for a while."

Suddenly, you heard something rustle in the bushes. You jumped up to see what it was, but the flora around you blocked anything except moving leaves and the sun that shone down through the canopy.

"Dammit, I`m a sitting duck out here," you said, looking around for any sign of life. "I have to move..."

So what happens next?
